alert.note: Alert for Granville (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:19PM EDT until May 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN VANCE...SOUTHEASTERN GRANVILLE...NORTHEASTERN WAKE AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 418 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Wake Forest, or 11 miles southeast of Creedmoor, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters have reported half dollar sized hail from the storm in Cary and Morrisville. RDU Airport also measured a wind gust of 63 mph. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Louisburg, Wake Forest, Franklinton, Kittrell, Rolesville, Youngsville, Centerville, Ingleside, Falls Lake Boat Ramp and Purnell. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
